Guacamole
Baked Chicken
Roasted Vegetables
Tomato Basil Bruschetta

string-array.name: recipe_descriptions
string-array.item: A classic Italian pasta dish made with spaghetti, bacon, eggs, and Parmesan cheese. The bacon is cooked until crispy and added to the spaghetti and egg mixture for a creamy and savory dish.

A dip made with mashed avocados, diced onion, tomato, jalapeño pepper, garlic, and lime juice. It\'s a popular Mexican dish that\'s often served with tortilla chips or as a topping for tacos or burritos.

Chicken breasts marinated in olive oil, garlic, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper, then baked in the oven until fully cooked. It\'s a simple and flavorful dish that\'s perfect for a quick and easy weeknight meal.

A healthy and flavorful dish made with a variety of vegetables, including carrots, potatoes, broccoli, cauliflower, bell peppers, and onions. The vegetables are tossed with olive oil and seasoned with salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and dried thyme, then roasted in the oven until tender and lightly browned. It can be served as a side dish or a main course.

An Italian appetizer made with toasted baguette slices topped with a mixture of diced tomatoes, fresh basil, red onion, garlic, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and black pepper. The tomato mixture is spooned over the toasted bread, creating a delicious and colorful bite-sized snack that\'s perfect for parties or as an appetizer before a meal.

string-array.name: recipe_ingredients
string-array.item:
Ingredients: 
 1 pound spaghetti 
 6 slices of bacon 
 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese 
 3 eggs 
 Salt and pepper to taste

Ingredients: 
 2 ripe avocados 
 1/4 cup diced onion 
 1 small tomato, diced 
 1 jalapeño pepper, seeded and minced 
 2 cloves garlic, minced 
 Juice of 1 lime 
 Salt and pepper to taste

Ingredients: 
 4 chicken breasts 
 1/4 cup olive oil 
 2 cloves garlic, minced 
 1 tablespoon dried basil 
 1 tablespoon dried oregano 
 Salt and pepper to taste

Ingredients: 
 1 pound of mixed vegetables (such as carrots, potatoes, broccoli, cauliflower, bell peppers, onions) 
 2 tablespoons olive oil 
 1 teaspoon salt 
 1/2 teaspoon black pepper 
 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder 
 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme

Ingredients: 
 6-8 ripe tomatoes, diced 
 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil 
 1/4 cup chopped red onion 
 1 clove garlic, minced 
 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar 
 2 tablespoons olive oil 
 Salt and black pepper, to taste 
 1 baguette, sliced

string-array.name: recipe_instructions
string-array.item:
Instructions: 
 1. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. 
 2. While spaghetti is cooking, fry bacon until crispy, then chop into small pieces. 
 3. In a bowl, whisk together Parmesan cheese, eggs, salt, and pepper. 
 4. When spaghetti is cooked, drain and add to the bowl with the egg mixture. Toss to coat. 
 5. Add the bacon and toss again. 
 6. Serve hot and enjoy!

Instructions: 
 1. Cut the avocados in half, remove the pit, and scoop out the flesh into a bowl. 
 2. Mash the avocado with a fork until it's mostly smooth. 
 3. Add the onion, tomato, jalapeño pepper, garlic, lime juice, salt, and pepper to the bowl. 
 4. Mix everything together until well combined. 
 5. Serve with tortilla chips or as a topping for tacos or burritos.

Instructions: 
 1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). 
 2. In a bowl, mix together the olive oil, garlic, basil, oregano, salt, and pepper. 
 3. Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish. 
 4. Pour the olive oil mixture over the chicken, making sure each piece is well coated. 
 5. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through. 
 6. Serve hot and enjoy!

Instructions: 
 1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). 
 2. Cut the vegetables into bite-sized pieces and place them in a large mixing bowl. 
 3. Drizzle olive oil over the vegetables and toss until they are coated. 
 4. Add salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and dried thyme to the bowl and mix well. 
 5. Spread the vegetables out in a single layer on a baking sheet. 
 6. Roast in the oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and lightly browned. 
 7. Serve hot as a side dish or as a main course with rice or quinoa.

Instructions: 
 1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). 
 2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the diced tomatoes, chopped basil, chopped red onion, minced garlic, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and black pepper. Mix well. 
 3. Arrange the baguette slices on a baking sheet and bake for 5-7 minutes, or until lightly toasted. 
 4. Top each slice of baguette with a spoonful of the tomato mixture. 
 5. Serve immediately as an appetizer or snack.
